comment.author: 29056926@N02
comment._content: Consolidated Gas Company (now Consolidated Edison) headquarters, at 15th and Irving. Photograph is from construction between 1911-1914. They're installing girders after the surrounding buildings were completed, to raise this structure another six floors. Probably 1913? "By this time, however, the firm had decided that a 12-story building would be inadequate. More land was purchased to the east, and Hardenbergh was requested to design and 18-story building for the entire site. There was no problem in constructing the structures for the east and west sides of the lot, but the original 12-story central section did not have a structural system that could support extra floors. The solution was to build the end wings and then construct girders between them and suspend the additional stories."

comment.author: 15283643@N04
comment._content: The date is visible along the top right side in reverse: 8/4/13 (Aug.4, 1913)

comment.author: 29056926@N02
